    • Method Detail

      • getResourceId

        int getResourceId​(java.lang.String resourceName,
                  ResourceType resourceType)
        Retrieves the ID for the specified resource.

        Resource IDs may not be constant between runtimes in all environments and should not be persisted.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - The resource name. If the resource file has an extension, it MUST be omitted.
        resourceType - The resource type
        Returns:
        The ID of the resource, or -1 if no resource with the given name/type is found.

      • openRawResource

        java.io.InputStream openRawResource​(int resourceId)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a stream for reading the raw bytes of the specified resource. The named resource must have a type of one of the following:
        • ResourceType.Drawable
        • ResourceType.Font
        • ResourceType.Raw
        • ResourceType.Xml
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource ID
        Returns:
        An InputStream providing access to the resource data or null if no such named resource exists or the resource type is not interpretable as a byte stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openRawResource

        java.io.InputStream openRawResource​(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                    ResourceType resourceType)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a stream for reading the raw bytes of the specified resource.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource
        resourceType -
        • ResourceType.Drawable
        • ResourceType.Font
        • ResourceType.Raw
        • ResourceType.Xml
        Returns:
        An InputStream providing access to the resource data or null if no such named resource exists or the resource type is not interpretable as a byte stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getColor

        int getColor​(java.lang.String resourceName)
        Returns the named color resource as a 32-bit integer packed ARGB value.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The resource name
        Returns:
        The color resource as a 32-bit integer packed ARGB value
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the specified resource does not exist or is not a color resource
